byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Djibouti, and Mohammed Ali Kalfood from Sana, Yemen.

abstract: Pentagon officials say Iranian naval convoy, suspected of carrying arms to Houthi rebels in Yemen, abruptly turned around because of United States naval presence off coast of country; credit American deployment with easing tensions in proxy war between Saudi Arabia and Iran.
lead_paragraph: Pentagon officials said the deployment — and Iran’s apparent response — had lowered tensions in the regional proxy war between Tehran and Saudi Arabia.

headline.main: American Naval Force Off Yemen Gets Credit After Iranian Convoy Turns Away
headline.print_headline: American Naval Force Off Yemen Gets Credit After Iranian Convoy Turns Away

snippet: Pentagon officials said the deployment — and Iran’s apparent response — had lowered tensions in the regional proxy war between Tehran and Saudi Arabia.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
